subject: RE: Antwort: [junit] junit 3.5 and visua age 3.5
msgSnippet: ... As I understand it, support of VAJ has been dropped from JUnit. JUnit.org is planning on covering support of JUnit in IDEs and such. ... These instructions
messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Ralf.Espenschied@... [mailto:Ralf.Espenschied@...]
> Sent: Thursday, February 15, 2001 1:24 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Cc: leon@...
> Subject: Antwort: [junit] junit 3.5 and visua age 3.5
>
> Hi,
>
> I have a solution for that:
> - use the vaj\tools\test-ui directory from JUnit 3.2
> hint: for those people who create the JUnit zip file, please insert the
> vaj-related stuff next time

As I understand it, support of VAJ has been dropped from JUnit.
JUnit.org is planning on covering support of JUnit in IDEs and
such.

> - install the tool according to the doc\vaj\vaj.htm file from
> JUnit 3.2 except
> for the following point "Installing JUnit as a VisualAge for Java tool"
> -> replace point 2, last item ("click Edit... and enter JUnit")
> with "click Edit
> ... Add Directory... choose JUnit from your project-resources tree (e.g.
> c:\program files\IBM\VisualAge for Java\ide\project_resources\JUnit)
> hint: could someone add this in the documentation for VisualAge
> 3.0 and newer
> versions

These instructions seem to match with what we have at:
http://www.junit.org/junit/doc/vaj/vaj.htm

I've deleted the file in files that was out of date.

> In my case the sample tests run successfully.
>
> Hope it helps, Ralf.
>

Should this allow JUnit to appear on "Tools"? If so I
too am having difficulties.

--
Erik Meade emeade@...
Senior Consultant Object Mentor, Inc.
http://www.junit.org
